pull.title: guix: pre time-machine bump changes (Windows)
pull.body:
This is some refactoring to the Windows Guix build that facilitates bumping our Guix time-machine. Namely, avoiding `package-with-extra-configure-variable`, which is non-functional in the newer time-machine, see https://issues.guix.gnu.org/64436.

At the same time, consolidate our Windows GCC build into `mingw-w64-base-gcc`.
Rename `gcc-10-remap-guix-store.patch` to avoid changing it whenever GCC changes.

We move the old `building-on` inside `explicit-cross-configure`, so that non-windows builds continue to work. Note that `explicit-cross-configure` will be going away entirely (see #27897), so this is only temporary duplication.

Split out of #27897. Most of the [[WIP] Windows commit](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27897/commits/e50d5f8953225ce68c18de7b892ee53d4ee0e5d5), minus the gcov change, as it's not-yet needed, and any gexp changes, which need the newer time-machine.

I'll also be splitting out the other changes we can do pre-timemachine bump, for easier review.

verification.payload:
tree a44d8f72f0b2dccd0c1a0072fac9a190e25c0b76
parent 7bf078f2b7d4a0339d053144b4fb35fe020dac25
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1690205906 +0100
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1692356546 +0100

guix: pre time-machine bump changes (Windows)

Split out of #27897. This is some refactoring to the Windows Guix build
that facilitates bumping our Guix time-machine. Namely, avoiding
`package-with-extra-configure-variable`, which is non-functional in the
newer time-machine, see https://issues.guix.gnu.org/64436.

At the same time, consolidate our Windows GCC build into mingw-w64-base-gcc.
Rename `gcc-10-remap-guix-store.patch` to avoid changing it whenever GCC changes.

We move the old `building-on` inside `explicit-cross-configure`, so that
non-windows builds continue to work. Note that `explicit-cross-configure`
will be going away entirely (see #27897).

guix: pre time-machine bump changes (Windows)

Split out of #27897. This is some refactoring to the Windows Guix build
that facilitates bumping our Guix time-machine. Namely, avoiding

At the same time, consolidate our Windows GCC build into mingw-w64-base-gcc.
Rename `gcc-10-remap-guix-store.patch` to avoid changing it whenever GCC changes.

We move the old `building-on` inside `explicit-cross-configure`, so that
non-windows builds continue to work. Note that `explicit-cross-configure`
will be going away entirely (see #27897).

Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#24123](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24123) (build: Pointer Authentication and Branch Target Identification for aarch64 Linux (Guix) by fanquake)
* [#21778](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21778) (build: LLVM 16 & LLD based macOS toolchain by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

comments.body:
Why does this variable need to be redefined?
Can't this just be:
```diff
-  (define building-on (string-append (list-ref (string-split (%current-system) #\-) 0) "-guix-linux-gnu"))
-  (package-with-extra-configure-variable package "--build" building-on))
+  (package-with-extra-configure-variable package building-on))
```

`package-with-extra-configure-variable` expects 3 arguments:
`(define (package-with-extra-configure-variable p variable value`
so we need a separate `--build` & value.
Yeah totally, sorry for the noise.
